celtickezz: Hell to the yes for all of this 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼
emiloumansfield: Totally agree...most plus size models in Aus are not plus size at all...totally pointless...we really can’t see how the garment will sit & fall on a larger body
lauren.a.hughes: Yes to this! I went to my very first yoga class last night and was so nervous to go because of my size. I would love to see more curves in active wear advertising ♥️
truuudo: Yesssss, I want to see more everyday woman doing their normal everyday things, in the media. Wearing nice clothes for Sunday picnics, a stunning outfit for nights out and in their active wear advertising the truth about who things fit and their tights don’t slips down. I love my @activetruth tights and crop top. Perfect for my new found love of Hip Hop classes. See, even fat people can dance.
womanofstyleandsubstance: Yes!! I'd also like to see mord curvy people but also over 30/40. Over 40s seem to not be recognised by brands, even though we probably have more disposable income than younger groups 🤷‍♀️
theconsciousspace: Yes girl!!! We have a few shoots coming up. Collabs with ethical and sustainable brands. I’d love to chat with you about being involved as a (paid!) model xx
paularovingstyle: A massive YES to more diversity in main stream media 😁❤️❤️
whimsybotanicals: Yes 🙌 I love this post! It's about time Australia got with the times. You are absolutely beautiful!
rebecca_a_lamont: So my physio said that reformer Pilates would be good for my chronic back pain. The only thing is when I’ve researched studios and looked at insta and their website the people featured are long, lean and athletic looking. When I’ve said this to a couple of studios they’ve said “you know what insta is like” or “don’t believe everything you see on the screen”. Which really doesn’t cut it. By not featuring people who are bigger it says ‘this is not for you’. 😞😞
a_knights_creations: Yes yes yes! I get so angry at the ppl against using us bigger girl - we’re not saying “go out and get fat” but the reality is that some of us have and always will have curves. So represent us! Show us the clothes we want to buy on a model who looks like us. Great on the yoga place for featuring you ❤️ yoga is not about being skinny and is for ALL bodies but unfortunately I know some bigger girls are too scared to try
theroadmatravels: What's the wee block your using? I have a bad wrist and would love to try yoga with some support for my bad wrist!
celineleilaniskin: Yes I notice this alot! Australia is so far behind in everything to be honest but especially this. The UK and US have so many body positive campaigns and celebrate this. They are all inclusive.
so_cindylu: There is a studio in my home town of Ballarat that had a yoga for bigger bodies! Best hr of my week!
danni__elle__: Yess this is what I look like doing yoga 🙏 Took me so many years to finally go along to a class cos I was intimidated by the typical yogi advertising! Well done @iamthatyoga 👏 I'm sure you'll convert many more curvy gals with these kinds of photos 😊
thesimpleglamazon: You're absolutely right! we need to see bigger bodies in health and fitness ads!! Thin does not always equal healthy!
beautifulimages.photography: Yes! 👏🏻🙌🏼 Love everything about this post, and you look fighting fab! 💖
jessie_haddacks88: YES YES YES!!!!!!!!!! I wish there were exercise groups you could find for bigger people to do fitness classes with. It’s something I’ve been actively looking for. I experienced fat shaming by my Osteopath/Pilates Teacher last week and it was honestly awful and really upset me for days... I also brought some active wear from a very popular brand recently in my usual sizing and I could not believe these leggings when they arrived. They barley go up to my knees let alone past my hips 🤦‍♀️😂 Thankyou for sharing activetruth and this amazing post 💗
jillian.hebels: I find it weird when you go to Sportsman's Warehouse they fit my feet, but not my body 🤦‍♀️
curls.curves.charisma: Question: where do you find yoga positions/tools needed for plus size or maybe someone who cant stretch as well due to chronic pain? I did yoga quite a bit when I was thinner (and sick) bibi feel like I dont know where to start now.
daniarmstrong: It infuriates me that larger bodies being active are fat-shamed, especially when the shakers go on about promoting health. Surely it’s healthier for all bodies to be moving more! I love this Sam!!
newstylechapters: I agree with this so much. I’m not a fan of size 14/16 trying to sell to size 22/24. It just doesn’t work.
mi.shell.my.belle: 🙌🏻🙌🏻 if only more studios were like this! joril_92: So so so true. One of my favourite brands does have one maybe two visibly larger bodies on their pages but their official models are size 10-12. beautifullyfkedup: And while we are talking plus size brands - if they’re going to use that tagline and description to describe themselves, maybe go beyond a size 22 🤷🏼‍♀️
curvysam: @zarc_clothing are another one of my fave brands that use a variety of models (and have just launched activewear)
willowcurves: Love seeing different bodies doing different things! Keep it up!
activetruth: What a great shot! And looks like a beautiful studio too 👏🏻
